channel.title: [317] Beastly Tech [317]
channel.description:
[center][img]http://i45.tinypic.com/98ahq8.png[/img][/center]
About Beastly Tech: Beastly Tech was originally a regular old forum that provided an extensive amount of boards for various types of discussions including subjects related to the internet, technology and regular life, but after some deep thought, I decided to add some other activities that users could enjoy whilst waiting for new posts on the forum. So far I've added some neat little tools like an anonymous email sender, as well as some simple services such as forum and general software installs. Even though those are kind of "cool", I wanted something even cooler and something that would bring much more traffic through Beastly Tech, a Runescape private server! Despite me mainly being a website developer, I'm going to try my hardest to create a successful Runescape private server, but I'm in dire need of help.
Resources I already have: - "Unlimited" paid web hosting from Host Gator. (Paid monthly) - A .com domain to present the website in a professional manner. (Paid annually) - A dedicated server for the private server to be hosted one. (Owned by a friend but he no longer needs it) - A standard IP.Board (Invision Power Board) license. (Was a one time payment of $149.99 USD)
Goals: - Create an entertaining and exciting server that maintains a stable economy at all times. - Create a server that has an extremely friendly environment for users that decide to play Beastly Tech. - Create a server that has perfected the majority of the most important features of a server.
As I've mentioned before, I do not have much experience as a private server coder and I'm definitely not afraid to admit that. This is why I'm trying to put together a development team. Unlike most users who decide to create a development team, I do not give up on things I've started. Whether it's successful or not, I will not stop working until it's completely dead. Yes, I realize other users in hope of starting successful communities have given this speech before, but I will always stay true to my word, that's one promise I can confidently make.
Base source: Dusk has decided to use Project Insanity as the base source of the Beastly Tech private server.
That being said, here are the positions I need filled.
- Server developer (1) - Client developer (1-2)
As for graphics and web development, I have everything covered.
If you're interested in applying for the Beastly Tech development team, please fill out this form.
[code]Name: Age: Coding experience: What "role" would you like to fill?: Why should I choose you over the other applicants?: What type of commitments are you willing to make?: MSN/Contact information: [/code]
Current team: Dusk/duskybby - Server developer
Note: If you're interested in checking out the website beforehand, feel free to shoot me a private message.

item.title: [317] Beastly Tech [317]
item.dc:creator: @Amayzing Amayzing
item.description:
@Amayzing wrote:

[quote=“Nexus_, post:13, topic:341343”]Name: Mike.
Age: 15.
Coding experience: From 12.
What “role” would you like to fill?: A server programmer (“coder”)
Why should I choose you over the other applicants?: Because I’ve helped in alot of other projects…
What type of commitments are you willing to make?: I have the full summer to code, so yeah.
MSN/Contact information: stolarz@live.com. Im always on.[/quote]

I apologize for the long response, I’ve been terribly busy with school and what not, but fortunately, tomorrow is the last day and I’ll no longer have anything else to do other than basketball.

All applicants have been denied with the exception of Nexus_, I’ve sent you a friend invitation on MSN, we’ll chat.

Read full topic

yugioh101:

item.title: [317] Beastly Tech [317]
item.dc:creator: @yugioh101 yugioh101
item.description:
@yugioh101 wrote:

iiLandon15:

yugioh do you know “HELLO!” in java? That handles your Public Classes and etc. i believe =) I’m still learning it. I am going to go to college when im older for Java coding.

lol i dont handel classes that much -.- never reall did like them

and if your reffering to my post in the help section why dont you try doing the following,

make an interface with a kick button,
then make the interface show up when you right click player options on the player,
then when the interface opens store a global variable that is the players name that you can then
use in a different file, to be used in a command to then kick said player.

Age:17
Coding experience:started when i was 12, small stuff learning the basics then moved up to Visual Basic Express, i can do almost ANY thing with VBE then i started java, i’ve been working on servers scene i was 14 so i have experience with them im just getting into interfaces and im doing really good already, so i know what i’m doing.
What “role” would you like to fill?:Server Coder/client work.
Why should I choose you over the other applicants?:Because im always in contact with whoever i need to be in contact with, im reliable and trustworthy. i get the job done the right way the first time and i get it done effectively.
What type of commitments are you willing to make?:Contact info if need be(cell or what not, willing to put it like 5-6hrs a day if i can 10+ on the weekends. i’m very flexible summers almost here and i don’t think im getting a job(hard to get were i am) so ill be available most of the time.
MSN/Contact information:halo_1_and_2_king@hotmail.com

item.title: [317] Beastly Tech [317]
item.dc:creator: @Duskybby Duskybby
item.description:
@Duskybby wrote:

I’d really like more people to show interest in this. It really can be the start of something great. We will be using Project Insanity as a base and I’ve already finished removing the anti-leech and have gotten to work. I’m sure everyone here knows, but Project Insanity is an amazing source based on Emulous and I’d love some people to work with on this.

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Beastly Tech [317]
item.dc:creator: @Amayzing Amayzing
item.description:
@Amayzing wrote:

[quote=“Duskybby, post:4, topic:341343”]I’m very interested in this. I’d love to join the project.

Name: Adam

Age: 17

Coding experience: I started coding when I was 9, and have been progressing (slowly, with breaks at times) over the past few years. I am very experienced in Java and quite a few other languages.

Why should I choose you over the other applicants?: I’m a very competent, dedicated person. Unlike others, I quite enjoy working on a project, even during the rougher times. I do not give up on what I start and work hard no matter what. At times you’ll find me up losing sleep until something is corrected or dealt with. I don’t mind working hard and being serious, but when it really comes down to, I’m fun, have a good sense of humor, and am quite easy to work with.

What type of commitments are you willing to make?: I’m willing to do whatever it takes to get what is asked of me done. I have more than enough time to do whatever I need to do, considering I’m pretty much out of school for the next few months, and I’ll do anything I can to make sure it’s done. I’ll stay up late working on something or even learning something completely new so that I can finish whatever needs to be done. You will find me many times asking for new work or asking to help with something because I find it a lot more fun to join and work on something than I do sitting around and doing nothing.

MSN/Contact information: risingtekniq@hotmail.com. You can catch me on MSN or you can email me.[/quote]

Outstanding application, however, I’d still like to ask you a few questions over MSN if that’s alright.

I sent you a friend invitation over MSN. Oh and I apologize for not including what “role” you’d like to fill within the “application outline”, I’ll make sure to update that now.

Read full topic

I’ll stay up late working on something or even learning something completely new so that I can finish whatever needs to be done. MSN/Contact information: risingtekniq@hotmail.com. You can catch me on MSN or you can email me.

item.title: [317] Beastly Tech [317]
item.dc:creator: @Amayzing Amayzing
item.description:
@Amayzing wrote:

Phaze One:

Why don’t we collaborate? Talk to me on msn

I’ll think about it… I’ve done things similar in the past and they didn’t end well. Seeing as I’m blindly recruiting members to help out though, I don’t think there’s much of a difference between “collaborating” with you and recruiting random members from Mopar to help me in my quest of creating a successful Runescape private server.

All of the positions are still open. It seems as if no one has shown any interest in helping out, but like I said, I won’t be giving up.

[center][/center]

About Beastly Tech: Beastly Tech was originally a regular old forum that provided an extensive amount of boards for various types of discussions including subjects related to the internet, technology and regular life, but after some deep thought, I decided to add some other activities that users could enjoy whilst waiting for new posts on the forum.   • A .com domain to present the website in a professional manner. (Paid annually)
  • A dedicated server for the private server to be hosted one. (Owned by a friend but he no longer needs it)
  • A standard IP.Board (Invision Power Board) license. (Was a one time payment of $149.99 USD)

  • Create an entertaining and exciting server that maintains a stable economy at all times.
  • Create a server that has an extremely friendly environment for users that decide to play Beastly Tech.
  • Create a server that has perfected the majority of the most important features of a server.

As I’ve mentioned before, I do not have much experience as a private server coder and I’m definitely not afraid to admit that. This is why I’m trying to put together a development team. Yes, I realize other users in hope of starting successful communities have given this speech before, but I will always stay true to my word, that’s one promise I can confidently make.

Base source: Dusk has decided to use Project Insanity as the base source of the Beastly Tech private server.

That being said, here are the positions I need filled.

  • Server developer (1)
  • Client developer (1-2)

As for graphics and web development, I have everything covered.

If you’re interested in applying for the Beastly Tech development team, please fill out this form.

Name: Age: Coding experience: What "role" would you like to fill?: Why should I choose you over the other applicants?: What type of commitments are you willing to make?: MSN/Contact information:
